results.title: The Pawnshop [Silent]
results.creator_credit: Charles Chaplin and Lone Star Corporation
results.brief_description: Charlie Chaplin, handyman in a pawnshop, finds himself competing for the attention of the shop-owner’s daughter (Edna Purviance) with the pawnshop assistant. Shows Charlie as a combination janitor and assistant who gets involved in comic rivalry with the other assistant, causing confusion with customers and finally turning hero in a robbery. Cast also includes Henry Bergman, John Rand, Albert Austin, Wesley Ruggles and Eric Campbell.

results.title: The Pattern of progress
results.brief_description: The dynamic progress and development of Davies Coop, now one of Australia’s largest textile manufacrtuing companies. Scouring, spinning, and e=eaving processes are imaginatively photographed, creating a sreies of rhythmic and artistic patttersn in keeping wiht the tempo of a modern progressive age. Laboratory tests and research tests and research reslut in the creation of new and exiting colorus and textures, continually increasing the production range.

results.title: The Pattern of Britain: crofters
results.creator_credit: Ralph Keene, Edgar H. Anstey and Verity Films
results.brief_description: The life of a crofting community in the extreme north-west of Scotland. By communal activity and shared effort, the people of this region make a living by agriculture, grazing and fishing. This film was made with the co-operation of the villagers of Achriesgill, in Southerlandshire, Scotland.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ralph Keene, Edgar H. Anstey and Verity Films

results.title: The Pattern of beauty
results.creator_credit: Stephen Cross, Paul Keeler and Stephen Cross Ltd
results.brief_description: Explains and demonstartes some of the ideas which are fundamental to the Islamic visual arts. Islamic art and architecture are based on the tenet that the more beautiful a thing is, the closer it approaches the Real.

results.title: The Patrol method
results.creator_credit: Boy Scouts of America. Visual Education Service
results.brief_description: This film is designed primarily for training of scout leaders in principles and methods of scouting, with the patrol as the basic unit. it is recommended that the Scout Leader see the film several times during the period of a year, so that he has an opportunity to apply what he learns about the technique of Patrol method, and then go back to restudy the film in light of his own methods.

results.title: The Patient pedestrian
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Australian Road Safety Council
results.brief_description: Filmed in Sydney, this short safety trailer tells of the work the Road Safety Council is attempting to do to make the crossing of busy streets safe for the pedestrian. Commentary by Russ Tyson.

results.title: The Pastoral balance
results.creator_credit: Ian Hart, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows some of the features of the Australian beef cattle industry, concentrating on recent advances in breeding and pasture improvement. Examines modern pastoralism in terms of a systems approach, the inputs being land, livestock, capital and labour, and the outputs beef and modification of the environment.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Hart, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
